law.catch_line: Wagers considered made in Kentucky -- Prohibited wagers -- Revocation of hub license -- Applicability of KRS 137.170, 138.480, 138.510, and Chapter 230.

text.section: Any wager that is made for an account maintained with the hub operator shall be considered to have been made in the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Account holders may communicate instructions concerning account wagers to the hub only by telephonic or other electronic means.
Any hub that processes any of the wagers delineated in subsection (3) of this section from a track, receiving track, or simulcast facility shall be subject to revocation of its hub license.
Except as provided in KRS 230.752, nothing in KRS 230.775 to 230.785 shall exempt racetracks or simulcast facilities from any taxes imposed under KRS 137.170, 138.480, 138.510, or Chapter 230.

law.history: Created 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 173, sec. 6, effective July 13, 2004.
